solution_line_template: Mike printed before the break {mike_speed_before_break} pamphlets per hour * {mike_hours_before_break} hours=<<{mike_speed_before_break}*{mike_hours_before_break}={mike_pamphlets_before_break}>>{mike_pamphlets_before_break} pamphlets

The working speed of Mike after the break was {mike_speed_before_break} pamphlets per hour / {speed_reduction_divisor}= <<{mike_speed_before_break}/{speed_reduction_divisor}={mike_speed_after_break}>>{mike_speed_after_break} pamphlets per hour

Mike printed after the break {mike_speed_after_break} pamphlets per hour * {mike_hours_after_break} hours= <<{mike_speed_after_break}*{mike_hours_after_break}={mike_pamphlets_after_break}>>{mike_pamphlets_after_break} pamphlets

Leo worked third of the time that Mike worked before the break, so he worked {mike_hours_before_break} hours / {leo_hours_divisor} = <<{mike_hours_before_break}/{leo_hours_divisor}={leo_hours}>>{leo_hours} hours

Leo worked twice as fast as Mike before his break {mike_speed_before_break} pamphlets per hour * {leo_speed_multiplier} = <<{mike_speed_before_break}*{leo_speed_multiplier}={leo_speed}>>{leo_speed} pamphlets per hour
Leo printed {leo_speed} pamphlets per hour * {leo_hours} hours = <<{leo_speed}*{leo_hours}={leo_pamphlets}>>{leo_pamphlets} pamphlets

Combining the pamphlets of Leo and Mike {mike_pamphlets_before_break} + {mike_pamphlets_after_break} + {leo_pamphlets} = <<{mike_pamphlets_before_break}+{mike_pamphlets_after_break}+{leo_pamphlets}={total_pamphlets}>>{total_pamphlets} pamphlets
